data.text: O death, how bitter is the remembrance of thee to a man that is at peace in his possessions,
O death, acceptable is thy sentence unto a man that is needy, and that faileth in strength,
Fear not the sentence of death;
And why dost thou refuse, when it is the good pleasure of the Most High?
The children of sinners are abominable children,
The inheritance of sinnersâ€™ children shall perish,
Children will complain of an ungodly father,
Woe unto you, ungodly men,
If ye be born, ye shall be born to a curse;
All things that are of the earth shall go back to the earth:
The mourning of men is about their bodies:
Have regard to thy name;
A good life hath its number of days;
My children, keep instruction in peace:
Better is a man that hideth his foolishness
Wherefore shew reverence to my word:
Be ashamed of whoredom before father and mother:
Of an offence before a judge and ruler;
And of theft in regard of the place where thou sojournest,
And of silence before them that salute thee;
And of turning away Or, the face of a kinsman  thy face from a kinsman;
Of being over busy with his maid; and come not near her bed;
Of repeating and speaking what thou hast heard;
So shalt thou be truly shamefast,
